title: How to Use a Focusing Rail in Macro Photography

steps.headline: Secure your focus rail.
steps.description: Usually, you would do this with a tripod, but if you have an alternative means, like a vise or a clamp, use that. It needs to be very secure. The focus rail is not light.

steps.headline: Fasten your camera to the rail.
steps.description: You will want to make sure that everything on the tripod and the rail is tightened down. If something is loose, the weight of your camera and the rail will bring it down, potentially to the ground.

steps.headline: Set your camera to 'infinity'.
steps.description: Basically, you need to put it to a higher Fstop and focus in the distance.

steps.headline: Practice your adjusting of the focusing rail before you put it into action.
steps.description: You want to be familiar with it so that you don't spend more time than necessary getting your shot.

steps.headline: Set up the shot and the camera as close as you can determine what you need the distance to be and you are ready to photograph.
steps.description: Then using the adjustment dials make incremental adjustments to your photograph.
